meanings.sent1: The heft of the book surprised the child.
meanings.sent2: She felt the heft of the rock in her hand.
meanings.sent3: The heft of the balloon made it impossible to float.
meanings.sent4: The heft of responsibility weighed heavily on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The heft of the hammer made it perfect for driving nails.

meanings.definition: To lift or carry something heavy
meanings.sent1: He tried to heft the box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She hefted the bag of groceries with ease.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried to heft the large bone.
meanings.sent4: She hefted the burden of her mistakes with determination.
meanings.sent5: He hefted the weight of his decision before making a choice.

meanings.definition: To assess the weight of something by lifting it
meanings.sent1: He paused to heft the watermelon before buying it.
meanings.sent2: She hefted the suitcase to see if it was too heavy.
meanings.sent3: The chef hefted the melon, trying to guess its ripeness.
meanings.sent4: She hefted the package, feeling its contents shift.
meanings.sent5: He hefted the axe, testing its balance before chopping wood.
